snippet: The way Chinese party officials identified the wife of deposed leader Bo Xilai may hint at more trouble for her, experts suggest.
abstract: Scholars are wondering why China’s Communist Party leadership identified Gu Kailai, the wife of the toppled party leader Bo Xilai, as 'Bogu Kailai' when it announced that she was under investigation for the murder of a British business executive; when Chinese women marry, they almost never take their husband’s family name; some experts say that calling her 'Bogu' may be a hint that she, despite being married to a member of the Politburo, also holds some other form of identification besides her mainland Chinese one.
lead_paragraph: The way Chinese party officials identified the wife of deposed leader Bo Xilai may hint at more trouble for her, experts suggest.
